pages.title: Compiler
pages.text: The Compiler is the bridge between the digital and physical realms. It allows you to materialize items directly from raw computational power, synthesizing matter from $(l:logicore:architecture/cycles)Cycles$().

pages.title: Operation
pages.text: Place a 'ghost' template item in the left slot. The Compiler will request $(l:logicore:architecture/cycles)Cycles$() from the network to match the item's defined cost.$(br)$(br)Once fully charged, the matter is synthesized and the result appears in the output slot.

pages.title: Processing Speed
pages.text: The compilation process is not instantaneous. The time required depends on the complexity (Cycle cost) of the object.$(br)$(br)Simple components materialize rapidly, while complex machinery requires a longer, stable connection to compile fully.
A matter-synthesis engine capable of rearranging atomic structures.

pages.title: Stack upgrade
pages.text: The Compiler supports adding $(l:logicore:components/stack_upgrade)Stack upgrades$() to it in order to increase the number of items it produces. Each stack upgrades increases it by 4 items, with a total of 16 upgrades it produces 64 items in one operation.
